entry.title: Robert 'Nash' Han: Wingman Extraordinaire
entry.summary:
Author: eightpackdiaz

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,688Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 1,306

Summary: “Eddie!” Nash yells repeatedly. “Eddie! Eddie!” Eddie feels himself turning bright red. “Wow,” he says after his name is repeated a good half a dozen more times in a row. “You weren’t kidding, huh?” “He’s been like this all day,” Maddie says with a grin on her face. She shifts Nash in her arms, pointing over at Eddie as she says, “Look who it is, sweetie. It’s Eddie!” Nash frowns, looking confused. “Eddie?” Maddie nods. “Yeah, that’s Eddie!” “Eddie!” Nash yells, reaching for Buck. “Eddie!” * (When baby Nash's first word is “Eddie”, questions are raised as to how this could possibly have happened.)

entry.summary:
Author: user_1224

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,405Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 77

Summary: Eddie walks right on in, as Maddie instructed. He looks around and doesn’t see sign of anyone. Until- until he hears a voice. A voice laced with static.“Wait Nahsy I need to get back to what I was saying. First- wait first I need to say thank you for listening to me so much, you’re the best baby listener ever of all time that a guy can have. Okay now, Eddie.”Eddie all but drops his phone onto the counter and holds his breath. entry.title: Repeat Until Death
entry.summary:
Author: eirabach

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,507Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 14

Summary: He's not an idiot — not about this stuff, anyway. Eddie knows he's petty. Remembers, with sparks of undimmed indignation, every shitty little glitterboy comment from the boy in fourth grade. Remembers, still, the sweet satisfaction of making the baseball team in his place. Eddie always preferred dancing to ball, but, hey. Whatever it takes. He's mostly grown out of it — petty revenge and teenage sons don't mesh, that's for sure — but there's always the odd moment. There's always Buck. [Or, Eddie's POV of (some) of Later Than Never]

Author: bugbugly

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,072Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 170

entry.title: Bound by Smoke, Claimed by Blood
entry.summary:
Author: Raeili64

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,984Chapters: 9/20Kudos: 300

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley runs into fire for a living. It’s what he’s good at—charging into chaos, finding the lost, and carrying them back into the light. When a call brings him face-to-face with Christopher Diaz, a boy trapped in the flames, Buck doesn’t hesitate. He pulls him out. He saves him.What Buck doesn’t expect is Christopher’s father.Eddie Diaz isn’t just a single dad. He’s a mob boss with blood on his hands, power at his back, and an obsession that sparks the moment he sees the firefighter who carried his son to safety. Gratitude twists into something sharper, darker. Eddie doesn’t just want Buck safe—he wants Buck his.Now Buck finds himself watched, followed, pulled into a world of shadows and violence he never asked for. But when accelerant burns through Christopher’s home and enemies send messages in fire, Buck realizes he’s already part of the war Eddie lives in.One saved child.One look across smoke.And nothing will ever be the same.

entry.title: When The Lights Go Out
entry.summary:
Author: penpen_xo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,173Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 206

Summary: Buck burst out laughing.And then he was really laughing, full bodied and loud. And he couldn’t seem to stop as dregs of liquid continued to trickle out of him. The poor LAFD guy before him was looking like Buck was losing his mind— and maybe he was right then, because this was the most ridiculous situation he'd ever found himself in. “What’s so funny exactly?” The guy asked with a raised eyebrow, amusement dancing in his perfect, brown eyes. “Because of course my water broke,” Buck huffed out, chest heaving as he kept laughing. “Of course that would happen while stuck in an elevator, with a stranger, with no way out.”   or   Buck, finally heading on paternity leave finds himself in a rather sticky situation, with a ridiculously handsome stranger.

entry.title: Even the Dead Still Breathe
entry.summary:
Author: BlckOnyx

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 104,402Chapters: 26/26Kudos: 222

Summary: It has been a year since Bobby’s death, and Buck has never been the same. Grief eats at him in quiet ways the rest of the 118 can’t quite reach, so when he announces he’s taking a break and heading abroad, everyone tells themselves he deserves the space. A week later, he disappears. Weeks turn into months, and the people he left behind are forced to believe the unthinkable—that Buck walked away for good. Until the headlines change, and the word “presumed dead” settles over them like ash. What none of them know is that Buck’s story didn’t end there. His grief, his secrets, and the dangerous truth he’s been carrying all lead back to a past no one at the 118 ever imagined. And when the pieces finally surface, the loss they thought they understood becomes something else entirely. How will the 118 deal with losing people they love, only to find out later that it was all a lie? OR Buck disappeared, and the truth might destroy what’s left of the family they built.

entry.title: One Date, and Then Everything
entry.summary:
Author: BlckOnyx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,393Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 302

Summary: Across the room, Chim groaned, leaning on his pool cue like Buck’s whining had physically worn him down. “For the love of God, just go on a date already! Eddie, take him out. Maybe then he’ll stop talking about it.” Eddie blinked, caught off guard. “Excuse me?” Hen snorted, immediately catching on. “Not the worst idea.” OR It started as a joke—Eddie needing to take Buck on a date.
